lead_paragraph: Landon Donovan was among 22 players picked for the United States men’s national team’s exhibition game at England next week and could make his 100th international appearance. Donovan, who leads the United States with 35 career goals, will be 26 years 2 months 24 days old when the Americans play at Wembley next Wednesday. According to the United States Soccer Federation, the only men to reach 100 appearances for their country at a younger age were South Korea’s Cha Bum-Kun, who was 24 when he reached 100 in 1977; and Saudi Arabia’s Sami al-Jaber and Mohammed al-Deayea, who were each 25 in 1998.
